DiscreteFunctions.jl

  • Readme
  • Docstrings
    • Docstrings
    Docstrings
    DiscreteFunctions.DiscreteFunction — Type.

    DiscreteFunction is a function from {1,2,...,n} to itself. It can be created by DiscreteFunction(list) where list is a one-dimensional array of positive integers. Alternatively, it can be created using positive integer arguments.

    The following are equivalent:

    DiscreteFunction([1,4,2,3])
DiscreteFunction(1,4,2,3)
    DiscreteFunctions.DiscreteFunctions
    DiscreteFunctions.IdentityFunction — Function.

    IdentityFunction(n) creates the identity DiscreteFunction on the set {1,2,...,n}.

    DiscreteFunctions.RandomFunction — Function.

    RandomFunction(n) creates a random DiscreteFunction on {1,2,...,n}.

    DiscreteFunctions.all_functions — Function.

    all_functions(n) returns a generator that produces all DiscreteFunctions on {1,2,...,n}

    DiscreteFunctions.all_sqrts — Function.

    all_sqrts(f::DiscreteFunction) returns an array consisting of all g such that g*g==f.

    DiscreteFunctions.all_squares — Function.

    all_squares(n) returns a list of all function on [n] that are perfect compositional squares.

    DiscreteFunctions.eval
    Permutations.fixed_points — Function.

    fixed_points(f::DiscreteFunction) returns a list of fixed points of the function, i.e., those values x such that f(x)==x.

    DiscreteFunctions.has_inv — Function.

    has_inv(f::DiscreteFunction) tests if f is invertible.

    DiscreteFunctions.has_sqrt — Function.

    has_sqrt(f::DiscreteFunction) checks if there is a function g such that g*g==f. Returns true if so and false otherwise.

    DiscreteFunctions.image — Function.

    image("f::DiscreteFunction") returns a Set containing all the output values of f.

    DiscreteFunctions.include
    DiscreteFunctions.is_permutation — Function.

    is_permutation(f::DiscreteFunction) returns true if f is a bijection on its domain.

    DiscreteFunctions.random_square — Function.

    random_square(n) returns a DiscreteFunction on n elements that has a compositional square root.

    Base.sqrt — Function.

    sqrt(f::DiscreteFunction) returns a DiscreteFunction g such that g*g==f or throws an error if no such g exists.
